metadata.title: CVE-2024-26932 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:typec: tcpm: fix double-free issue in tcpm_port_unregister_pd() Whenunregister pd capabilitie in tcpm, KASAN will capture below double -freeissue. The root cause is the same capabilitiy will be kfreed twice, thefirst time is kfreed by pd_capabilities_release() and the second time isexplicitly kfreed by tcpm_port_unregister_pd(). [ 3.988059] BUG: KASAN:double-free in tcpm_port_unregister_pd+0x1a4/0x3dc [ 3.995001] Free of addrffff0008164d3000 by task kworker/u16:0/10 [ 4.001206] [ 4.002712] CPU: 2PID: 10 Comm: kworker/u16:0 Not tainted6.8.0-rc5-next-20240220-05616-g52728c567a55 #53 [ 4.012402] Hardware name:Freescale i.MX8QXP MEK (DT) [ 4.017569] Workqueue: events_unbounddeferred_probe_work_func [ 4.023456] Call trace: [ 4.025920]dump_backtrace+0x94/0xec [ 4.029629] show_stack+0x18/0x24 [ 4.032974]dump_stack_lvl+0x78/0x90 [ 4.036675] print_report+0xfc/0x5c0 [ 4.040289]kasan_report_invalid_free+0xa0/0xc0 [ 4.044937]__kasan_slab_free+0x124/0x154 [ 4.049072] kfree+0xb4/0x1e8 [ 4.052069]tcpm_port_unregister_pd+0x1a4/0x3dc [ 4.056725]tcpm_register_port+0x1dd0/0x2558 [ 4.061121]tcpci_register_port+0x420/0x71c [ 4.065430] tcpci_probe+0x118/0x2e0 To fixthe issue, this will remove kree() from tcpm_port_unregister_pd().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic-64k - 6.8.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-aws - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-azure - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gcp - 6.8.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-gke - 6.8.0-1004.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-ibm - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency - 6.8.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle - 6.8.0-1006.6
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1005-raspi - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oem - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1005.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-35.35').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1009.9').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.8').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.9').
linux-gke package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1004.7').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-35.35.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1005.5').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1005.12').
linux-raspi-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-2004.4').
linux-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.1-1002.2').
